questions.text: What is 'edge computing' in the context of IIoT?
options: A type of cloud computing located at the edge of the world
Processing data on a centralized cloud server
Moving computation and data storage closer to the sources of data
A new type of computer monitor
questions.correctAnswer: Moving computation and data storage closer to the sources of data

questions.text: What is a primary advantage of edge computing over cloud computing for IIoT applications?
options: Unlimited storage capacity
Reduced latency for real-time decisions
Higher processing power for large-scale model training
Simpler security management

questions.text: Which of the following tasks is most suitable for an edge device?
options: Long-term archival of historical factory data
Training a complex deep learning model with terabytes of data
Immediate shutdown of a machine upon detecting a critical anomaly
Running the company's enterprise resource planning (ERP) system
questions.correctAnswer: Immediate shutdown of a machine upon detecting a critical anomaly

options: Another term for cloud computing
Computing in misty or foggy weather conditions
A decentralized computing infrastructure where data, compute, storage, and applications are distributed between the data source and the cloud
A type of quantum computer
questions.correctAnswer: A decentralized computing infrastructure where data, compute, storage, and applications are distributed between the data source and the cloud

questions.text: How do edge and fog computing relate to each other?
options: They are the same thing
Edge computing is a subset of fog computing
Fog computing is a layer that sits between the edge and the cloud
They are completely unrelated concepts
questions.correctAnswer: Fog computing is a layer that sits between the edge and the cloud

questions.text: A smart camera that performs on-device object detection to identify defects on a production line is an example of:
options: Cloud computing
Edge computing
Mainframe computing
Grid computing

questions.text: Which of these is a potential drawback of edge computing?
options: Increased network bandwidth usage
Higher latency
Limited processing and storage resources on edge devices
Centralized point of failure
questions.correctAnswer: Limited processing and storage resources on edge devices

questions.text: A hybrid IIoT architecture typically involves a combination of:
options: Only edge devices and cloud
Only fog devices and cloud
Edge devices, fog computing, and cloud computing
Only on-premise servers
questions.correctAnswer: Edge devices, fog computing, and cloud computing

questions.text: Why is edge computing important for autonomous vehicles?
options: It allows the car to stream movies from the cloud
It is not important for autonomous vehicles
It enables low-latency decisions for obstacle avoidance and navigation
It helps the car choose the best music playlist
questions.correctAnswer: It enables low-latency decisions for obstacle avoidance and navigation

questions.text: What is a 'micro data center' in the context of edge computing?
options: A very large, centralized data center
A small, self-contained data center located closer to where data is generated
A data center that only stores a small amount of data
A data center powered by microscopic batteries
questions.correctAnswer: A small, self-contained data center located closer to where data is generated
